page.title: 04Houses in Newtown
page.content: The old Victorian houses in the area were built of sandstone.These houses have fancy lintels and date marks. In the late 19th.Century terraced houses were built for the railway and mill workers. This century many houses have been built by the council though a large number of householders are buying their council houses.When a council house becomes a private one we generally notice new doors and windows quite soon. The council houses built soon after the second World War are now being modernised by the council.New fireplaces,cupboards and kitchens are being fitted. The newest council scheme is called Whitefield.Very few private houses have been built in recent years.
